Leaves: Rosette leaves are larger, spoon shaped and with jagged edges, stem leaves are lance shaped, small and very jagged.
Flowers: Single 3-5 cm wide on long stem with yellow centre and white petals.
FruitSeeds: Very small 2-3 mm long, dark brown to black, cylindrical with tapered end.
Habitat: Disturbed areas, grasslands, alpine areas, wetlands, burnt areas.
DistinguishingFeatures: Smaller than Shasta Daisy, larger flowers and different leaves to Stinking Mayweed.
